snippet: State Senator Thomas K. Duane, 57, said he had simply tired of ricocheting between New York City and Albany, as he has for nearly 14 years.
abstract: New York State Senator Thomas K Duane announces his decision to retire after nearly 14 years; Duane made his mark as the first openly gay member of the State Senate and was a pivotal figure during the state's recent same-sex marriage battle.
lead_paragraph: State Senator Thomas K. Duane, 57, said he had simply tired of ricocheting between New York City and Albany, as he has for nearly 14 years.

headline.seo: State Senator Thomas Duane, a Gay Rights Advocate, to Retire
headline.main: Champion of Gay Rights to Leave New York State Senate
headline.print_headline: Longtime Gay Rights Champion to Retire From the State Senate

keywords.value: Same-Sex Marriage, Civil Unions and Domestic Partnerships
keywords.name: subject
